meanings.definition: To throw or cast incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: He misthrew the ball and it landed far from the target.
meanings.sent2: She misthrew the frisbee, causing it to veer off course.
meanings.sent3: During the game, he misthrew the ball so badly that it hit the referee!
meanings.sent4: Her words misthrew the whole situation into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The magician misthrew the cards, making them scatter everywhere.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in throwing or casting.
meanings.sent1: The quarterback misthrew the pass, leading to an interception.
meanings.sent2: I misthrew the dart and it missed the bullseye by a mile.
meanings.sent3: She misthrew the paper airplane, accidentally hitting her friend in the head.
meanings.sent4: His actions misthrew the entire plan into disarray.
meanings.sent5: The chef misthrew the pancake, causing it to land on the floor.
